DataMatrix.description: A set of time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

DataMatrixResult.description: Time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

unixTime.description: The time that a data point was recorded

DataVector.description: A set of time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

DataVectorResult.description: Time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

MetricsData.description: The data points in a metrics collection

authenticationUser.description: The username required to authenticate with the DNS provider

apiKey.description: The API key or password required to authenticate with the DNS provider

ScanDomainForRecordsRequestProviderConfi.description: Provider-specific configuration needed to scan a domain

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

errorType.description: The type of error encountered when querying for metrics

error.description: The error encountered when querying for metrics

warnings.description: Warnings encountered when querying for metrics

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

MX record data follows the format `<priority> <value>`, without `<>`s.

weight.description:
A zone record's priority

A resource record is replicated in StackPath's DNS infrastructure the number of times of the record's weight, giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type.

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a DNS zone record

Zone record labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

id.description:
The ID of the resource record to update

Do not provide an ID to create a new resource record

zoneBulkCreateOrUpdateZoneRecordMessage.description: The fields needed to create or update a DNS zone resource record

records.description: The records to create or update in the DNS zone

zoneRecordIds.description: The IDs of the newly created and updated resource records

zoneBulkCreateOrUpdateZoneRecordsRespons.description: A response from a request to create or update multiple DNS zone resource records

zoneRecordIds.description: The IDs of the resource records to delete

zoneBulkDeleteZoneRecordsMessage.description: The fields needed to delete multiple DNS zone resource records

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a DNS zone

Zone labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

useApexDomain.description:
Whether or not to create a zone for the apex domain only

If this is true and a domain with subdomains is provided, it will be stripped and only the root domain will be used for the zone. If this is false an error will be returned if it's not already an apex domain.

zoneCreateZoneRecordResponse.description: A response from a request to create a new DNS zone resource record

zoneCreateZoneResponse.description: A response from a request to create a new DNS zone

zoneDnsProvider.description:
The types of DNS providers that StackPath can detect

DNS provider types can trigger different logic when StackPath scans a domain

requiresAuthentication.description: Whether or not the provider requires authentication to scan or modify the domain

zoneGetDiscoveryProviderDetailsResponse.description: A response from a request to scan a domain name for information about its provider

configured.description: Whether or not all required name servers are configured in the zone

requiredNameservers.description: The nameservers required in the zone's configuration

zoneGetNameserversForZoneResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve information about a DNS zone's authoritative nameservers

zoneGetZoneRecordResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a DNS zone resource record

zoneGetZoneRecordsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a DNS zone's resource records

zoneGetZoneResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a DNS zone

zoneGetZonesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve all DNS zones in a stack

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

MX record data follows the format `<priority> <value>`, without `<>`s.

weight.description:
A zone record's priority

A resource record is replicated in StackPath's DNS infrastructure the number of times of the record's weight, giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type.

zoneImportZoneRecord.description: A DNS zone resource record, as imported from a 3rd party provider

zoneFile.description: Base64 encoded BIND zone file contents

records.description: The resource records StackPath was able to import from a zone file

zoneParseRecordsFromZoneFileResponse.description: A response from a request to parse records from a zone file

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

MX record data follows the format `<priority> <value>`, without `<>`s.

weight.description:
A zone record's priority

A resource record is replicated in StackPath's DNS infrastructure the number of times of the record's weight, giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type.

zoneRecordType.description:
The resource record types supported by StackPath

- EMPTY: The resource record has no type
 - A: The resource record translates a host to an IPv4 address
 - AAAA: The resource record translates a host to an IPv6 address
 - CNAME: The resource record aliases one name to another
 - TXT: The resource record contains a descriptive string. Many applications use TXT records for configuration
 - MX: The resource record defines a mail exchanger for the given host
 - SRV: The resource record defines a service on the domain
 - NS: The resource record describes a nameserver that serves its domain's zone and records
 - CAA: The resource record describes a certification authority authorization that adds validation to which certificate authorities can issue certificates for a domain

records.description: The resource records StackPath was able to scan from the domain

zoneScanDomainForRecordsResponse.description: A response from a request to scan a domain for its resource records

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a DNS zone

Zone labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

MX record data follows the format `<priority> <value>`, without `<>`s.

weight.description:
A zone record's priority

A resource record is replicated in StackPath's DNS infrastructure the number of times of the record's weight, giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type.

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a DNS zone record

Zone record labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

zoneUpdateZoneRecordResponse.description: A response from a request to replace a DNS zone resource record

zoneUpdateZoneResponse.description: A response from a request to replace a DNS zone

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a zone belongs to

accountId.description: The ID of the StackPath account that owns a zone

version.description:
A zone's version number

Version numbers are incremented automatically when a zone is updated

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a zone

Zone labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

created.description: The date a zone was created

updated.description: The date a zone was last updated

nameservers.description:
The hostnames of the StackPath resolvers that host a zone

Every zone has multiple name servers assigned by StackPath upon creation for redundancy purposes.

verified.description: The date a zone's nameservers were last audited by StackPath

disabled.description: Whether or not a zone has been disabled by the user

zoneZone.description:
A DNS zone

A zone represents an individual domain in StackPath's DNS infrastructure.

zoneId.description: The ID of the zone that a zone record belongs to

name.description:
A zone record's name

Use the value "@" to denote current root domain name.

type.description:
A zone record's type

Zone record types describe the zone record's behavior. For instance, a zone record's type can say that the record is a name to IP address value, a name alias, or which mail exchanger is responsible for the domain. See https://support.stackpath.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001085563-What-DNS-record-types-does-StackPath-support for more information.

class.description:
A zone record's class code

This is typically "IN" for Internet related resource records.

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

MX record data follows the format `<priority> <value>`, without `<>`s.

weight.description:
A zone record's priority

A resource record is replicated in StackPath's DNS infrastructure the number of times of the record's weight, giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type.

labels.description:
A key/value pair of user-defined labels for a zone record

Zone record labels are not processed by StackPath and are solely used for users to organize their DNS zones.

created.description: The date a zone record was created

updated.description: The date a zone record was last updated

zoneZoneRecord.description:
A DNS zone's resource record

A zone record describes an individual piece of DNS functionality in a DNS zone.
